physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ejection fraction below 35%. Symptoms of heart failure included inability to sleep horizontally.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially improved after treatment, but worsened to ejection fraction of 19% and NYHA class III to IV symptoms one year later.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Resting tachycardia, Cheyne-Stokes respirations, limited energy, weight loss, and poor glycemic control.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms worsened leading to increased ACE-I dose and institutions for home monitoring.
